doc.after: An aria Italian air plural arie or arias in common usage diminutive form arietta in music was originally any expressive melody usually but not always performed by a singer The term became used almost exclusively to describe a self contained piece for one voice with or without orchestral accompaniment normally part of a larger work The typical context for arias is opera but vocal arias also feature in oratorios and cantatas sharing features of the operatic arias of their periods
